synopsis: In episode #12 of the podcast, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome the talented musician and teacher Valante, who shares his journey through personal struggles, creativity, and the importance of connection. The conversation delves into the transformative power of music, the complexities of human relationships, and the beauty of simply existing in the moment.
quotes: If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
You can change the world in small ways, just because you're not giving up all of your possessions doesn't mean you're not helping.
It's normal to not always be on the same page; miscommunications can happen.
The greatest thing ever is just doing absolutely nothing with my time.
I think a lot about my students and try to give them a sense of peace, but they might be too young to really take it aboard.
You can expect music, but there's no plan. It just depends.
Sometimes the commune was just booming with creativity from a lot of different people.
Take the opportunity and tell the people close to you that you love them. Don't wait.
